## GAD-7 vs SHAPS

Comparing psychological assessments like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Snaith Hamilton Pleasure Scale (SHAPS) can be a daunting task. These different tools, which address different aspects of our psychological health, often require careful comparison for a more comprehensive understanding of an individual's mental state. However, with the aid of Harmony, the process of comparing 'GAD-7 vs SHAPS' and the like has become far more streamlined. Harmony, a software using advanced natural language processing and generative AI models, is designed to facilitate the harmonisation process. Rather than sifting through vast PDFs and manually correlating questions across different questionnaires, Harmony can automate the comparison process proficiently. Exploring 'GAD-7 vs SHAPS' with Harmony, psychologists can get a percentage match between the different items in these questionnaires, enabling them to make informed interpretations. Researchers can not only compare these questionnaires, but also apply their analyses across multiple languages, enhancing the scope and reach of their studies. The software's interface supports both database selection and uploading new instruments in PDF form, thus making it a versatile tool for psychologists globally. So, next time you need to analyze 'GAD-7 vs SHAPS' or any other questionnaire comparison, Harmony is the platform to bank on.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and SHAPS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and SHAPS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SHAPS into Harmony</a> - compare SHAPS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
